thread.title: Proposed bonfire fee is buzzkill for college beachgoers
thread.title_full: Proposed bonfire fee is buzzkill for college beachgoers - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Jenna Lyons
title: Proposed bonfire fee is buzzkill for college beachgoers
text:
Photo: Franchon Smith, The Chronicle Hanging out at Ocean Beach enjoying their campfire and the mild weather, left to right, Academy of Art students Ren Kaws, 21, Rosemary Xue, 21, Lisa Wang, 20, Stella Yang, 19, and Daniel Chang 19 on October 18, 2015. Hanging out at Ocean Beach enjoying their campfire and the mild...
It’s one thing to require a permit for beachgoers to kick back and relax at the fire pits scattered across San Francisco’s Ocean Beach, but for some of the younger, college crowd that frequents the areas on weekends, the proposed $35 fee is a buzzkill when looking for a cheap way to have fun in an expensive city. Hanging out at Ocean Beach enjoying their campfire and the mild weather, left to right, Academy of Art students Ren Kaws, 21, Rosemary Xue, 21, Lisa Wang, 20, Stella Yang, 19, and Daniel Chang 19 on October 18, 2015. Hanging out at Ocean Beach enjoying their campfire and the mild...
It’s one thing to require a permit for beachgoers to kick back and relax at the fire pits scattered across San Francisco’s Ocean Beach, but for some of the younger, college crowd that frequents the areas on weekends, the proposed $35 fee is a buzzkill when looking for a cheap way to have fun in an expensive city.
